China is having a field day making fun of the 
first US Presidential Debate of the 2024 election

cycle! Sadly, they’re kind of right to. But 
Beijing’s watching for more reasons than humor.
Welcome to China Uncensored, I’m Chris Chappell.

Today, July 1 is the 27 year anniversary 
of the British handover of Hong Kong to
China. So real quick, before I begin this episode,

five years ago, Matt, Shelley, and I were 
in Hong Kong watching two million people

march through the streets to protest the 
HK government and, ultimately, the CCP.

So to commemorate it, China Uncensored is 
partnering with the Hong Kong Democracy Council

to create the first ever digital Hong Kong Lennon 
Wall. A place for people around the world to

show their support for Hongkongers by writing 
digital post-it notes of support for Hong Kong.

Again, that website is Hklennonwall.com 
. I’ll leave a link below. We built this

site with a team of security experts. It’s 
completely anonymous. It does not track cookies

or any other personal information. 
It does not store IP addresses.
If you’ve already signed, thank you,

and please ask your friends and family to 
sign as well. Let’s see how many we can get!
And now, on to the rest of the show.
Late last week, the US held the first

of the 2024 presidential debates, 
featuring Joe Biden and Donald Trump.

And there were many, many reasons 
to be concerned after watching it.

One big reason to be concerned is that China 
seems to be having a field day mocking the debate.

Chinese media outlets and prominent social 
media users weighed in, commenting on the

age of both Joe Biden and Donald Trump, 
as well as their perceived shortcomings.

Hu Xijin, the former editor in chief 
of my favorite chinese state run media,
the Global Times , wrote on X,

“personal attacks, hazy memory, 
mocking each other…this debate was

very entertaining. Objectively speaking, the 
low-quality performance of these two old men

was a negative advertisement 
for Western democracy.”
Remember folks, China has the best democracy!
Just ask the Uyghurs.

Hu wasn’t the only one 
commenting on the debate, though.

Financial news site Cailianshe wrote 
of the matchup, “this chaotic rhythm

almost dominated the entire debate, and many 
people lamented: one has Alzheimer’s disease,

and the other is mentally ill, 
they are really evenly matched.”

State-owned Beijing News also chimed in! It 
said that “Biden was habitually confused,
and Trump continued to spread rumors.”

On social media, the debate was 
likened to a “kindergarten quarrel!”

Although, I don’t think that’s 
a fair assessment. Considering

the age of the candidates, it’s more 
like a 3PM dinner quarrel at Denny’s.
Remember, China has no presidential debates or

elections, and Xi Jinping is no 
spring chicken at 71 years old.

But one of the dangers of the debate gone 
wrong is exactly that–the Chinese Communist

Party does not have scenes of elderly, incoherent 
candidates rambling on or shouting at each other.

Of course sometimes elderly former 
leaders get, uhh…escorted away.

For years, the CCP has been claiming 
that its one-party system is, in fact,

a democracy, even one that 
works better than the US.

So the CCP is using the debate as an 
example of why US-style democracy is bad

and might actually be less preferable 
than the so-called “Chinese Model” that

Beijing has tried to export 
to various other countries.

And some popular influencers on Weibo , China’s 
version of X, are already making that point.

Chu Mingyu, who has 1.9 million 
Weibo followers, wrote, “this just

points out the fundamental problem of American 
democracy. Americans don’t elect a president,

but someone who is more suitable to play 
the president on TV.” And she goes on in

her post to say that Trump is a liar, but that 
Biden’s rambling incoherence was even worse.

In an even more savage Weibo post about the 
debate, popular blogger Housha Moonlight,

with almost 4 million followers, wrote that 
it didn’t matter what the debate was about,

“the key is that the witty & flexible 
Trump successfully highlighted the
old and dying appearance of the sleeping king.”

That’s ridiculous, Biden isn’t the 
sleeping king. The My Pillow guy is.
And he endorsed Trump

As of recording, Xi Jinping hasn’t 
publicly commented on the debate.
But others on social media sites in China have

continued mocking Joe Biden’s 
seeming lack of awareness,
as well as some dubious claims from Trump.

In fact, the debate seems to have garnered 
so much attention in China that a company

whose Mandarin name sounds like “Trump 
Wins Big” saw a surge of 10% in shares!

But it’s only fair that China talks so much 
about the debate because the candidates sure

talked about China a lot during the debate. 
Donald Trump mentioned China a dozen times.

Only Russia was mentioned more when 
it came to foreign policy questions!
Which shouldn’t be surprising, since we all know

how much Trump loves talking about China. 
Clips of Trump saying China over and over
I’ve really missed that.

During the debate, Trump hailed his policies 
on China during his tenure in the White House,
while accusing Biden of being soft on China.

Trump: We're closer to World War III than 
anybody can imagine. We are very very close

to World War III, and he's driving us there, 
and Kim Jong-un and President Xi of China,

Kim Jong-un of North Korea, all of these, Putin, 
they don't respect him. They don't fear him.

Trump: We have the largest deficit with 
China. He gets paid by China. He's a

Manchurian candidate. He gets money from China. 
We have, so I think he's afraid to deal with them

or something. But you notice he never took out my 
tariffs because we bring in so much money with the

tariffs that I imposed on China. He never took 
them away. Can't, because it's too much money.

Biden got in on the China action, as 
well, though without the Trumpian flair.

Biden: Number two: you have not in fact 
made any contact, any any any progress with

China. We are the lowest trade 
deficit with China since 2010.

Trump has promised not just to resume his 
previous China policies, but to ramp them up.

According to Bloomsberg, “Trump 
has already floated ideas including

a 10% across-the-board tariff, and 
steeper levies on Chinese-made goods.”

Back in February it was talk of more 
than 60% tariffs on Chinese imports.
And that’s causing some level of alarm in Beijing!

Liu Pengyu, the spokesperson for China’s 
Embassy in the US , said “on China-U.S. trade,

I want to stress that China-U.S. economic 
and trade cooperation is mutually beneficial

in nature.” He also said that “no one 
will win a trade war or a tariff war.”

He also said that “no one will 
win a trade war or a tariff war.”

Which is curious, since China is 
currently pursuing tit-for-tat

anti-dumping measures for 
imports of European pork.

Liu also stated that China won’t interfere in the 
US elections, and that it hopes for development

in US-China relations no matter who wins the 
election. But he did say that the CCP opposes

“the US frequently making an 
issue of China in the election.”

China won’t interfere in the elections? I 
wouldn’t put too much stock in that statement!

China is already seeking to interfere in the 
US election, as it has with other countries.
The question is what the Chinese Communist Party,

with now the largest navy in the world, wil 
do if it views the US as being unstable.

It’s unclear exactly what either Trump or Biden 
would do regarding China if elected, but you

can be sure of one thing: China Uncensored will 
always call the CCP out, but we need your help.
For as little as a dollar a month,

you can support us on Patreon so 
that we can keep uncensoring China,
and as a thank you to our Patreon supporters,

I answer one of your questions 
at the end of these episodes.

Today’s question comes from Fast Zombies 
“I think CCP's death row is going to be

pretty crowded if supporting 
the ROC is a capital offense.”

So Fast Zombies is responding 
to China’s recent announcement

That it will give the death penalty 
to Taiwan independence diehards.

Since it technically applies to 
anyone, anywhere in the world,
yeah, death row would be pretty crowded.

Of course right now the CCP 
can’t enforce it like that,

but I think they would be very happy 
to have more prisoners on death row.

You see, China has no functional 
organ donation system.

So they were harvesting organs 
from executed prisoners.
But they didn’t stop there.

“Some of the more than 1.5 million 
detainees in Chinese prison camps

are being killed for their organs to 
serve a booming transplant trade that

is worth some $1 billion a year, 
concluded the China Tribunal,

an independent body tasked with investigating 
organ harvesting from prisoners of conscience”

For clarity, that’s not talking 
about people who committed a crime.

The Communist Party launched 
a massive persecution of Falun

Gong practitioners in 1999, using them 
as a massive “volunteer” organ bank.
When that source got depleted
They turned to Uyghurs.
And according to China Journalist Ethan Gutmann,

whose book the Slaughter exposed 
China’s organ transplant system…

If China successfully conquers it, 
Taiwan will be the next organ bank.
Remember,

“a booming transplant trade that 
is worth some $1 billion a year”
And no organ donation system. Think about that.

So thank you for your question and 
your support Fast Zombie. That’s what

makes it possible for me to spread awareness 
about things like China’s organ harvesting.

And you too can join fast Zombies on 
Patreon by clicking that orange button.

And in my ongoing attempt to talk 
about topics YouTube considers too

controversial by hiding them in gaming 
content, click here for a lesson on

the dangers of cults of personality 
according to the game Dragon’s Dogma 2.
Once again, I’m Chris Chappell. See you next time.

summary: China is mocking the first US Presidential Debate of the 2024 election cycle, with Chinese media outlets and social media users criticizing the debate as chaotic and low-quality. The Chinese Communist Party (CCP) is also using the debate to promote its own political system as a model for other countries, claiming that the US-style democracy is flawed. The CCP is also watching the debate to see how the candidates address China, with Trump mentioning China a dozen times and accusing Biden of being soft on China. China's Embassy in the US has called for a mutually beneficial trade relationship with the US, but the CCP is also pursuing anti-dumping measures for European pork imports and has a history of interfering in other countries' elections.

0:05:02.160000 --> 0:05:06.520000
how much Trump loves talking about China. 
Clips of Trump saying China over and over

0:05:10.120000 --> 0:05:12.120000
I’ve really missed that.

0:05:12.120000 --> 0:05:16.320000
During the debate, Trump hailed his policies 
on China during his tenure in the White House,

0:05:16.320000 --> 0:05:18.900000
while accusing Biden of being soft on China.

0:05:18.900000 --> 0:05:21.782000
Trump: We're closer to World War III than 
anybody can imagine. We are very very close

0:05:21.782000 --> 0:05:26.760000
to World War III, and he's driving us there, 
and Kim Jong-un and President Xi of China,

0:05:26.760000 --> 0:05:32.460000
Kim Jong-un of North Korea, all of these, Putin, 
they don't respect him. They don't fear him.

0:05:32.460000 --> 0:05:36.840000
Trump: We have the largest deficit with 
China. He gets paid by China. He's a

0:05:36.840000 --> 0:05:41.440000
Manchurian candidate. He gets money from China. 
We have, so I think he's afraid to deal with them

0:05:41.440000 --> 0:05:46.600000
or something. But you notice he never took out my 
tariffs because we bring in so much money with the

0:05:46.600000 --> 0:05:51.680000
tariffs that I imposed on China. He never took 
them away. Can't, because it's too much money.

0:05:51.680000 --> 0:05:55.660000
Biden got in on the China action, as 
well, though without the Trumpian flair.

0:05:55.660000 --> 0:06:02.760000
Biden: Number two: you have not in fact 
made any contact, any any any progress with

0:06:02.760000 --> 0:06:07.800000
China. We are the lowest trade 
deficit with China since 2010.

0:06:07.800000 --> 0:06:12.520000
Trump has promised not just to resume his 
previous China policies, but to ramp them up.

0:06:12.520000 --> 0:06:15.320000
According to Bloomsberg, “Trump 
has already floated ideas including

0:06:15.320000 --> 0:06:20.440000
a 10% across-the-board tariff, and 
steeper levies on Chinese-made goods.”

0:06:20.440000 --> 0:06:24.920000
Back in February it was talk of more 
than 60% tariffs on Chinese imports.

0:06:24.920000 --> 0:06:27.600000
And that’s causing some level of alarm in Beijing!

0:06:27.600000 --> 0:06:33
Liu Pengyu, the spokesperson for China’s 
Embassy in the US , said “on China-U.S. trade,

0:06:33 --> 0:06:37.560000
I want to stress that China-U.S. economic 
and trade cooperation is mutually beneficial

0:06:37.560000 --> 0:06:42.075000
in nature.” He also said that “no one 
will win a trade war or a tariff war.”

0:06:42.075000 --> 0:06:42.880000
He also said that “no one will 
win a trade war or a tariff war.”

0:06:42.880000 --> 0:06:45.680000
Which is curious, since China is 
currently pursuing tit-for-tat

0:06:45.680000 --> 0:06:49.400000
anti-dumping measures for 
imports of European pork.

0:06:49.400000 --> 0:06:54.280000
Liu also stated that China won’t interfere in the 
US elections, and that it hopes for development

0:06:54.280000 --> 0:06:59.960000
in US-China relations no matter who wins the 
election. But he did say that the CCP opposes

0:06:59.960000 --> 0:07:04.320000
“the US frequently making an 
issue of China in the election.”

0:07:04.320000 --> 0:07:09.440000
China won’t interfere in the elections? I 
wouldn’t put too much stock in that statement!

0:07:09.440000 --> 0:07:14.800000
China is already seeking to interfere in the 
US election, as it has with other countries.

0:07:14.800000 --> 0:07:16.920000
The question is what the Chinese Communist Party,

0:07:16.920000 --> 0:07:23.560000
with now the largest navy in the world, wil 
do if it views the US as being unstable.

0:07:23.560000 --> 0:07:28.600000
It’s unclear exactly what either Trump or Biden 
would do regarding China if elected, but you

0:07:28.600000 --> 0:07:34.280000
can be sure of one thing: China Uncensored will 
always call the CCP out, but we need your help.

0:07:34.280000 --> 0:07:35.720000
For as little as a dollar a month,

0:07:35.720000 --> 0:07:39.640000
you can support us on Patreon so 
that we can keep uncensoring China,

0:07:39.640000 --> 0:07:41.480000
and as a thank you to our Patreon supporters,

0:07:41.480000 --> 0:07:44.040000
I answer one of your questions 
at the end of these episodes.

0:07:44.040000 --> 0:07:50.720000
Today’s question comes from Fast Zombies 
“I think CCP's death row is going to be

0:07:50.720000 --> 0:07:55.440000
pretty crowded if supporting 
the ROC is a capital offense.”

0:07:55.440000 --> 0:07:58.720000
So Fast Zombies is responding 
to China’s recent announcement

0:07:58.720000 --> 0:08:03.360000
That it will give the death penalty 
to Taiwan independence diehards.

0:08:03.360000 --> 0:08:06.520000
Since it technically applies to 
anyone, anywhere in the world,

0:08:06.520000 --> 0:08:08.680000
yeah, death row would be pretty crowded.

0:08:08.680000 --> 0:08:11.560000
Of course right now the CCP 
can’t enforce it like that,

0:08:11.560000 --> 0:08:15.800000
but I think they would be very happy 
to have more prisoners on death row.

0:08:15.800000 --> 0:08:19.480000
You see, China has no functional 
organ donation system.

0:08:19.480000 --> 0:08:22.880000
So they were harvesting organs 
from executed prisoners.

0:08:22.880000 --> 0:08:24.560000
But they didn’t stop there.

0:08:24.560000 --> 0:08:29.160000
“Some of the more than 1.5 million 
detainees in Chinese prison camps

0:08:29.160000 --> 0:08:33.720000
are being killed for their organs to 
serve a booming transplant trade that

0:08:33.720000 --> 0:08:38.320000
is worth some $1 billion a year, 
concluded the China Tribunal,

0:08:38.320000 --> 0:08:44.280000
an independent body tasked with investigating 
organ harvesting from prisoners of conscience”

0:08:44.280000 --> 0:08:47.800000
For clarity, that’s not talking 
about people who committed a crime.

0:08:47.800000 --> 0:08:50.480000
The Communist Party launched 
a massive persecution of Falun

0:08:50.480000 --> 0:08:57.240000
Gong practitioners in 1999, using them 
as a massive “volunteer” organ bank.

0:08:57.240000 --> 0:08:59.440000
When that source got depleted

0:08:59.440000 --> 0:09:01.160000
They turned to Uyghurs.

0:09:01.160000 --> 0:09:03.320000
And according to China Journalist Ethan Gutmann,

0:09:03.320000 --> 0:09:07.480000
whose book the Slaughter exposed 
China’s organ transplant system…

0:09:07.480000 --> 0:09:12.320000
If China successfully conquers it, 
Taiwan will be the next organ bank.

0:09:12.320000 --> 0:09:12.960000
Remember,

0:09:12.960000 --> 0:09:17.640000
“a booming transplant trade that 
is worth some $1 billion a year”

0:09:17.640000 --> 0:09:21.240000
And no organ donation system. Think about that.
